page.title: 11Thurnham
page.content: Plover Scar light is unmanned and lit by Calor gas. Cockersand lighthouse was built in 1847 and is lit by electricity. There are sinking sands in the estuary: training walls were built in 1860/62. There are seven buoys all lit because of increaing numbers of pleasurecraft. They are pontoon buoys - more stable. There is a lighted Perch. There are two river pilots, one based at Glasson Dock and one at Sunderland Point. A submarine pipeline is now disused. The river and navigational aids are maintained by Lancaster Port Commissioners.
